column2: As an Inventory Control Manager, you will oversee and manage the inventory control processes to ensure efficient and accurate inventory management. You will be critical in maintaining optimal inventory levels, minimizing stock discrepancies, and implementing effective inventory control strategies.    Your primary responsibilities will include:    Inventory Management: Developing and implementing inventory management strategies and policies to optimise inventory levels, minimise carrying costs, and meet customer demand.   Ensuring accurate tracking and monitoring of inventory levels, stock movements, and replenishment processes.   Inventory Control Procedures: Establishing and maintaining effective inventory control procedures, including cycle counting, stock reconciliation, and regular physical inventory audits.   Implementing measures to prevent stockouts, overstocks, and obsolete inventory.   Supply Chain Collaboration: Collaborating with suppliers, vendors, and logistics teams to ensure accurate and timely inventory receipt. Managing relationships with suppliers and negotiating favourable terms for inventory procurement.   Demand Planning and Forecasting: Working closely with sales, operations, and procurement teams to develop demand forecasts and inventory replenishment plans.   Analysing sales data, market trends, and customer demand patterns to optimise inventory levels and prevent stock shortages or excesses.   Inventory Accuracy and Reconciliation: Conduct regular inventory reconciliations to ensure accuracy between physical inventory, stock records, and the inventory management system. Investigating and resolving any discrepancies or issues that arise during the reconciliation process.   Inventory Reporting and Analysis: Generating reports and analysing inventory levels, turnover rates, stock movements, and other key performance indicators.   Identifying trends, opportunities, and risks to support data-driven decision-making and continuous improvement.   Process Improvement: Continuously evaluating and improving inventory control processes, systems, and procedures to enhance efficiency, accuracy, and productivity.   Recommending and implementing automation tools and technologies to streamline inventory management processes.   Compliance and Regulatory Requirements: Ensuring compliance with applicable laws, regulations, and industry standards related to inventory control, including product labelling, storage, and handling requirements.   Team Management: Leading and supervising a team of inventory control personnel. Providing guidance, training, and coaching to team members to ensure their professional development and optimal performance.   Collaboration and Communication: Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including operations, sales, finance, and IT, to ensure alignment and effective coordination of inventory control activities. Communicating inventory-related information, trends, and insights to relevant stakeholders.    Qualifications and Skills:    Bachelor s degree in Supply Chain Management, Operations Management, Business Administration, or a related field. Relevant certifications   Proven experience in inventory control management, preferably in the technology or system integration industry.   Strong knowledge of inventory management principles, methodologies, and best practices.   Proficiency in using inventory management software and systems.   Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data, generate insights, and make data-driven decisions.   Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in inventory tracking and reconciliation.   Strong organizational and time management skills to handle multiple tasks and priorities effectively.   Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.   Leadership skills to manage and develop a team of inventory control personnel.   Problem-solving skills and the ability to identify and implement process improvements.   Knowledge of applicable laws, regulations, and industry standards related to inventory control.
column13: Procurement, Supply chain management, Team management, Sales operations, Analytical, System integration, Inventory control, Forecasting, Monitoring, Logistics

column2: Reporting to Manager-Operations, the Accountant will is responsible for performing monthly, quarterly and annual accounting activities including reconciliations of bank and credit card accounts, coordination and completion of annual audits, and reviewing financial reports/support as necessary.    The desired candidate will have a similar background of accounting and would be a part of preparing, computing, managing and analyzing all accounting data in order to provide qualitative information on financial position and cash flow of the business.      The successful candidate will have an      Experience in analyzing and reporting on financial status including income statement variances, communicating financial results to management, budget preparation and analysis.    Responsibility of general accounting function including preparing journal entries, maintaining balance sheet, ledgers and bank reconciliations.    Expertise in analyzing financial information.      KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES      As an   Accountant   at   IPSS   , You would be responsible forall day to day accounting aspects and keep the records up to date for management s perusal.  Generating the bills payable ,verifying the bills receivable and vendor payments.    Ensure GST filing and TAN deductions are being done on a periodic basis.    Updating the purchase orders, raising invoices, invoice entry of the bills in the system, book keeping.    Well versed in all accounting work, balance Sheet, P/L Account and all day to day related work.    Should be able to provide accounting assistance during and after the tender application process.    Processing full-cycle accounts receivable (creating and sending invoices, collecting from past-due accounts, cash applications).    Preparation of financial statements and all other adhoc financial reporting.    Liasioning with auditors to gather working papers for audit preparation and to ensure auditing is being done as per procedure on time.    Coordinating with Auditors for GST Filing, IT Individual Returns Filing,Support for IT,RoC Filing and to ensure that filing is being done as per procedure on time.    Working knowledge on Tally is a must and having knowledge of GST filing formalities would be an added advantage.      QUALIFICATIONS      Education and Experience      Bachelor s Degree or Diploma in Finance/Accounting.    1-2 years worth of experience working in a related role.      Knowledge, Skills and Abilities      Tally is must and if worked with ERP Softwares it would be good.    Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word etc.)    Advanced Microsoft Excel skills (VBA, formulas, functions)    Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

column2: As a full-stack Software Engineer, Technical Lead with Resolver, you will be responsible for designing and building software applications that enable innovative, data-driven, customer-centric digital experiences for Resolver customers. You will be working as part of a friendly, cross-discipline agile team that helps each other solve problems across all functions.   Youll also help build and grow a small Development team. You ll coach them along the entire development process, building new features while also taking an active role in their professional development.    Your Responsibilities:     Develop new user-facing features, from the database all the way up to the browser   Peer-review code, providing succinct and relevant feedback   Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability   Fix bugs in new and existing code   Build reusable and fully tested (unit tests we love mocha!) code   Create and maintain documentation that helps others understand what the software does, how it does it, and how to use it.   Provide mentorship, guidance, and regular one-on-one coaching   Conduct code reviews, providing succinct and relevant feedback     Our Current Projects:     Audit Trail Event Tracking with context isolation using Worker Threads in Node 12   Rich Mapping solution to visualize data with an interactive map, styled with custom markers and polygons   Advanced reporting with Point in Time using historical Data   Working with Lambda Architecture to provide concurrency, availability and scalability   Data Export engines to PDF, Word, Excel for reporting. This includes charts, tables etc. using SVG and other visualization technologies   Permissions, Security Models to ensure privacy and access control. This includes API, Internal Services Communication, Database level access and Permissions Computation within complex hierarchical data structures   Improvements to UI and UX using React/Redux to render/modify large data sets with real-time data synchronization using sockets, polling and state management   Continuing Technical Initiatives to improve application performance, code quality, developers quality of life and overall velocity   Application Health Monitoring and mitigation strategies     Your Background:     5+ years in development (including react.js and node.js)   Experience with AWS web application architecture   A passion for creating beautiful testable code   A distaste for spaghetti code   Security of your code is always top of mind

column2: We are seeking a key player to join our Commercial Execution team.    Your role will be focused in providing essential administrative support and ensuring prompt and consistent application of current commercial processes.        The role      Proposal Development: Support the Commercial team in the preparation of simple proposals, including pricing, using the current proposal templates and guidelines.    Bid Approval: Support the Commercial team with investigation, information gathering and ATQ completion (if applicable) related to simple bid submissions (as defined in the Bid Process).    Contract preparation: support the Commercial teams in the preparation of the final contracts /schedules / RfS/ RfAS to be signed by the clients, using the most recent versions of contract templates and adhering to contracting guidelines.    Sales quote creation: create and update ByD sales quotes    Block Fee Quotation Management: Support the Commercial team with the creation and through-life commercial management of Block Fee Agreements (BFA), including addressing BFA related contract queries raised by external clients (as applicable)    Bids & Contracts: Support the Bids & Contracts team for the execution of contract submission related to expiry and validation.    Client Training Coordination: Coordinate and manage external (client) training activities from contract initiation to course completion, for both public and in-company training courses, support in the creation of quotes and proposals for training services (as applicable)    Client Engagement: Address less complicated client queries which are within the scope of Commercial Operations and escalate when required to the appropriate subject matter expert, keeping salesforce updated and the account manager informed.    Feedback Handling: Escalate client feedback to the relevant account owner, and when required, support the prompt resolution of complaints in accordance with the complaints process, BMS and all applicable SLAs.    Process Adherence: Ensure adherence to all applicable processes (which shall include but not be limited to ByD and commercial processes).    Professional Integrity: Act at all time with integrity, and conduct activities in line with internal procedures, legislation and accreditation schemes; and pursue Continuous Professional Development to maintain a high level of relevant knowledge and awareness.    Client business reviews: support maritime sales community with research, analysis and market information and creation of periodic client business reviews.        What you bring      A degree or equivalent in a relevant field of study    Exposure in the business support field with understanding of sales and client care principles. Previous exposure in the same industry is highly preferred.    Previous experience supporting Account management activities in a virtual/international context.    Understanding of the market and marine environment to support commercial focus.    Use own initiative able to prioritize and work on multiple tasks whilst adhering to tight deadlines.    Flexible and results-oriented approach to meet varying and competing client and business demands.    Adaptability and well-organized approach with a practical mind    High degree of accuracy.    Ability to work as part of a team to contribute to achieving departmental/business objectives.    Computer literacy in MS Office.    Very good command (written and oral) in English language        You are someone who      Is keen to take accountability and ownership for delivering customer needs    Is able to self-manage and prioritize tasks towards achieving goals    Is effective at solving problems, trouble-shooting and making timely decisions    Is flexible and eager to take initiatives    Communicates in a structured way and has ability to present technical ideas in user-friendly language    Displays a team spirit, particularly in a multicultural environment    Responds positively to learning opportunities and is comfortable stepping out of own comfort zone

column2: Description  Over 1 , 000 of the world s largest organizations depend on Resolver s cloud software to protect their employees ,  customers ,  supply chain ,  brand and shareholders. That s about 1 , 000 , 000 people using our tools each day. Are you ready to make an impact Headquartered in Toronto ,  Canada ,  also known as Silicon Valley North ,  Resolver has locations in India ,  USA ,  UK ,  New Zealand and Dubai.  Job Summary:  The Performance Test Engineer will assess our software at every stage of development ensuring our software adheres to Resolver performance metrics as well as customer expectations. Responsibilities:  Framework and Scripts (60%)  Design ,  develop ,  and maintain the performance testing framework ,  tools and scripts  Document and track performance issues  Analyze root causes of performance issues and provide corrective actions  Document all relevant design documentation for performance testing purposes  Conduct system performance testing to ensure system reliability ,  capacity and scalability  Evaluate and make recommendations for future improvements to the existing performance testing framework ,  tools and associated processes Measures of Success: Consistent improvements to the performance framework; meeting and exceeding performance test targets  Standard and Metrics (40%)  Review ,  analyze ,  and validate technical and business requirements for performance testing purposes and translate them into key performance indicators (KPIs)  Work with product and testing teams to identify and understand key load and performance testing scenarios  Work closely with application development teams to identity performance issues while following performance testing best practices throughout the software development cycle  Analyze test results and prepare reports for stakeholders  Explains nonfunctional performance issues to the broader business team ,  and work towards resolution with appropriate teams  Compiles technical reports (performance test requirements ,  performance test plans ,  and performance test summary reports) Measures of Success: Well defined and measurable performance KPIs for each Resolver product line; performance reports for each major release  Your Background  Degree in Computer Engineering ,  Computer Science ,  Electrical Engineering ,  or equivalent experience  25 years of working experience testing a web application as part of a QE team  Extensive experience in performance testing webbased application solutions  Demonstrated experience with performance testing and analysis tools (Gatling ,  LoadRunner ,  BlazeMeter ,  etc.)  Solid experience in planning ,  developing and executing Performance (load / stress / scale) tests ,  analyzing the results and writing reports to Management  Working experience with PostgreSQL and Database profiling  Strong debugging skill in diagnosing test script failures  Experience with Scala Development or other mainstream programming languages (C# ,  Java ,  JavaScript)  Working experience with repository / builds tools for Continuous Integration  Exposure to Cloud and Mobile automation and AWS cloud services About You:  You re accountable to your work ,  ensuring projects are completed on time without sacrificing quality  You re an excellent problem solver that love to troubleshoot  You take time to develop collaborative relationships across Resolver  You take initiative without being asked ,  you see challenges as an opportunity to learn About Us: Resolver  We believe in hard work and having fun while we work. We invest in our people ,  and we think big. Great benefits and competitive pay  Flexible: our environment is flexible  Learning: we invest in the development of our people through online learning ,  group learning and external learning.  Wellness / fitness reimbursement: we care about your health Resolver Protects What Matters . Over 1 , 000 of the world s largest organizations use Resolver s cloud software to protect their employees ,  customers ,  supply chain ,  brand and shareholders.

The role     Conduct remote surveys of assets using various remote techniques, inspecting ship structures, equipment, machinery, and systems to gather relevant data.   Analyze and interpret data acquired during remote surveys to evaluate asset compliance with applicable rules, regulations, standards, and guidelines. Identify potential risks, defects, or non-compliances.   Prepare accurate and detailed reports documenting survey findings. Ensure timely recording, maintenance, and sharing of all relevant information with appropriate stakeholders.   Collaborate with technical experts and colleagues to address technical issues, interpret complex data, and provide guidance on survey methodologies and techniques. Offer technical support and assistance to stakeholders as required.   Keep up-to-date with the latest LR training and qualification requirements, industry developments, emerging technologies, and regulatory changes related to asset surveys.   Engage in continuous professional development activities to enhance knowledge, skills, and expertise in remote surveys and other digital servicesIdentify opportunities for process improvement, automation, and digitalization to optimize survey efficiency and effectiveness.   Proactively seek feedback from stakeholders and utilize it to improve survey processes, methodologies, and reporting standards. Regularly review and update survey practices based on lessons learned and industry advancements to ensure continuous improvement in the quality of surveys.   Communicate effectively with shipowners, managers, regulatory bodies, and other relevant stakeholders to ensure a clear understanding of survey objectives, requirements, and outcomes. Cultivate positive and collaborative relationships with clients and all stakeholders.   Meet established timelines and quality objectives for surveys to maintain operational efficiency.   Plan and execute surveys within agreed-upon timeframes, taking into account asset availability, scheduling constraints, client expectations, and operational efficiencies.         What you bring       A degree or equivalent from a recognized tertiary organization by Lloyds Register in the relevant field of engineering or physical science (minimum of two years program), or qualifications from a marine or nautical institution along with relevant experience as a certificated ships officer.   Adherence to professional codes of conduct and the LR Code of Ethics in IMS01.   Proficiency in utilizing a blend of general and specialized engineering knowledge to apply both existing and emerging technologies.   Capability to employ appropriate theoretical and practical methods for designing, developing, manufacturing, constructing, commissioning, operating, and maintaining engineering products, processes, systems, and services.   Ability to offer technical and commercial management, including project management and process management.   Proficiency in the English language at a level appropriate for the scope of work.   Experience and ability to work with people from different nationalities and cultures
column13: Automation, Project management, Process improvement, Scheduling, Surveyor, Continuous improvement, Operations, Technical support, Process management
